A dislocated wrist is a serious medical emergency that requires proper medical attention from qualified healthcare professionals. Attempting to set a dislocated joint without proper medical training can cause severe damage to nerves, blood vessels, ligaments, and other tissues.

If you or someone has a suspected dislocated wrist, please:
1. Seek immediate medical attention
2. Do not attempt to move or reset the joint
3. Immobilize the area if possible
4. Apply ice to reduce swelling while awaiting medical help

Only trained medical professionals should perform joint reduction procedures in appropriate clinical settings.
